title: Ma Sha Allah VS  Allah Humma Barik
transcript:
[Questioner] from Saudi Arabia yes I want to know when to use Ma Shaa Allah   and baraak Allah what are the 
difference between these two okay first of all to ward off to stop 
and prevent an evil eye from happening   from you against others the Sunnah is to 
say Allahuma baarik or Baarak Allah lak   and some would say tabarak Allah but this is not 
very strong so when you make a Dua with Baraka   from Allah blesses it this blocks your evil eye 
you won't inflict evil eye on that individual   others say that in Suratul Kahf when one 
of the guys was telling his friend that   had you said this statement when you saw your 
garden and how beautiful it is Ma shaa Allah   to stop and prevent yourself from giving an evil 
eye to your own possessions a lot of the scholars   say that this also prevents an evil 
eye specifically to your own stuff   not to others but a lot of the scholars 
say that it does the job mentioning the   name of Allah by saying Ma shaa Allah when 
you see a beautiful car or nice children   playing around and and their uh hyper 
this blocks your evil eye as well but   definitely saying Allahuma Baarik is the 
strongest and the most authentic of all
